title: whats up with the lag?
body: why is it that my friend plays league with 36 fps every game, but when i play (on the same computer) im always stuck between 3 and 17 fps? anyone wanna clarify why this happens?

replies.body:
There can be many factors, but just so we're on the same page; it sounds like you're talking about a performance issue instead of lag due to a connection issue. Since you're both playing on the same computer, it narrows the problem down a little. We can confirm that you're on the same network with the same computer hardware. However, the background applications you're running may differ--you might be running more stuff or different applications in the background that are eating up your system resources. On top of that, it's possible that your in-game settings could be different and demand more from your system while playing the game.

It might be a good idea to see what's different between you and your friend's experience outside the game and then once you're in-game (I recommend a Custom Game). It might be because the usage of different VOIPs, you guys might be using different music streaming services or programs. Lastly, check your in-game settings to see if anything is different when you two play (might be less likely if you use the same Windows user account).

If you're still stumped after doing all of that, I recommend contacting us through the [Support Site](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and my colleagues will be happy to look into this issue further.

Apologies for messaging you here but can we get some insight on the high pings, ping spikes and packet loss that has been happening since 5.18?

Y'all recently moved us to Chicago servers for a more stable and reliable connection to the game and so far it hasn't been happening.
